docs.text: Introduction Synopsys Polaris helps security and development teams analyze security risks in their software products. The Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin enables you to invoke Synopsys Polaris analysis from your Jenkins builds. Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins can be used in both freestyle and pipeline jobs. When the Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin runs, it checks the configured Synopsys Polaris server and the Jenkins node to see if the correct version of the Synopsys Polaris Command Line Interpreter (CLI) is already installed on the node. If not, the plugin installs the Synopsys Polaris CLI. In either case, Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins then executes the Synopsys Polaris CLI, which analyzes your project, and uploads results to Synopsys Polaris.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Requirements Requirements for Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins are: Access to the internet Jenkins versions 2.60.1 or higher. Non-LTS versions of Jenkins are not supported. Java 8. Synopsys Polaris, and a valid access token. The Synopsys Polaris CLI must run successfully from the command line on the project you are building, and the polaris.yml file must be included in the project source that is checked into the source code control system.

docs.text: Installing Before using Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins, you must install the plugin in Jenkins. For information on installing and updating plugins, refer to the Jenkins documentation .

docs.text: Configuring Once the Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins plugin is installed, before you can use it in a job, you need to configure: Synopsys Polaris CLI Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins Configuring Synopsys Polaris CLI Use the following process to configure Synopsys Polaris CLI: In Jenkins, navigate to Manage Jenkins Global Tool Configuration . Scroll down to the Polaris CLI section, click Add Polaris CLI, and complete the following: Name : A name for the Synopsys Polaris CLI installation. Required Installation directory : To let Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins install the Synopsys Polaris CLI from your Synopsys Polaris server automatically, leave this box checked, and proceed to the next step. To point Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins to an existing Synopsys Polaris CLI installation, uncheck this box and enter the path to the Synopsys Polaris CLI directory in the Required Installation directory field. Click Save. Configuring Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins Use the following process to configure Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins: After installing Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins in Jenkins, navigate to Manage Jenkins Configure System . Scroll down to the Synopsys Polaris section and complete the following: Polaris URL : The URL to your Synopsys Polaris instance. Polaris credentials : The Jenkins secret text credentials that you have created to store your Synopsys Polaris access token. Advanced : If you want to change the timeout that Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins will use when waiting for a response from the Synopsys Polaris server, click Advanced and enter the timeout in seconds in the Polaris connection timeout field. Test connection to Polaris : To test that Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins can connect to Synopsys Polaris with the configuration data you have entered, click Test connection to Polaris . Click Save.

docs.text: Using in a build To use Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins in a freestyle build, add it as a Build Step at the point where you want to build your project, and complete the following: Polaris CLI Installation : Select the name you assigned to your Synopsys Polaris CLI installation on the Manage Jenkins Global Tool Configuration page. Polaris Arguments : The arguments you want passed to the Synopsys Polaris CLI (for example: analyze ). Click Save. To use Synopsys Polaris for Jenkins in a pipeline build, add a the following step at the point where you want to build your project: polaris arguments: '{Synopsys Polaris CLI argument(s)}', polarisCli: '{Synopsys Polaris CLI installation name}' The value of arguments is a string containing all of the arguments you want to pass to Synopsys Polaris CLI. The value of polarisCli is the name you assigned to your Synopsys Polaris CLI installation on the Manage Jenkins Global Tool Configuration page. For example: polaris arguments: 'analyze', polarisCli: 'MyPolarisCLI'
